'Indene' is a flammable polycyclic hydrocarbon with chemical formula
C 9H 8. It is composed of a benzene ring fused with a
cyclopentene ring. This aromatic liquid is colorless although samples often are
pale yellow. The principal industrial use of indene is in the production of
indene/coumarone thermoplastic resins.
